placeMetadata.address: The Shakahari by Awadhpuri, Pushpak Complex, 101, Garden, opp. Prahlad Nagar, Prahlad Nagar, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380015, India

reviews.reviewText: Yesterday, I visited The Shaka Cafe for a Japanese food experience and tried the Shogan Box, which was absolutely amazing. The sushi and other Japanese delicacies were fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The quality of ingredients stood out, making every bite enjoyable. The cafe's cozy ambiance added to the experience, making it a perfect spot for sushi lovers and those exploring Japanese cuisine. Definitely a place worth revisiting!

Loved the vibe of this restaurant and the service was great. Presentation/plating was very cute and creative. There are so many options for food and different cuisines offered so there is something for everyone. We ordered some dumplings, chilli oil noodles, veg sushi and buns. Everything was pretty good, but maybe not the best I've tried in the city. I would still recommend a visit if you and your party want to try something new and different.

We tried flamingo daiquiri mocktail, truffle mushroom ramen, butter garlic gyoza , sichuan cracker bao bun and tiramisu. Everything tasted absolutely amazing. The flavours were to die for. All the dishes were more on the spicy side. The mocktail was not to our taste though. The tiramisu was heavenly.

The Shaka Cafe is a hidden gem that never fails to impress! On our second visit, we were once again captivated by the warm ambience, crafted with passion and attention to detail. The staff was incredibly polite, friendly and professional, making our dining experience seamless and enjoyable. The hospitality here truly sets the cafe apart.üåª‚ú®Ô∏è

As for the food‚Äîabsolutely outstanding! Every dish was prepared to perfection, from delicate dumplings and crispy churros to cheesy baked pasta. We also tried the Sichuan Cracker Cottage Cheese Bao and Litchi Basil Tiki Tuki, and they were simply amazing! The chef‚Äôs dedication to quality and taste shines through every bite. The love and passion that the owner has poured into this place are evident in every detail. If you haven‚Äôt visited yet, you‚Äôre missing out on an exceptional culinary experience. Kudos to Team Shaka! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

reviews.reviewText: Great Place with an awesome atmosphere but make sure while giving order on the first visit u ask for good/preffered dishes and quantity is so much don't just order in one go order one by one they don't have cancel order policy.

The place offers a visually pleasing dining experience with its well-designed interior and beautiful lighting, creating a cozy and inviting ambiance. While the atmosphere is delightful, the food quality varies not up to the mark. The pizza is underwhelming and lacks the expected flavors, while the self-made nachos fall short of expectations. However, the quesadilla is flavorful, and the avocado spaghetti is an absolute highlight with its creamy, rich taste. The Dora cake is another standout, perfectly balancing buttercream and cake for a satisfying dessert. Despite some inconsistencies, Maxicano by the Bay is suitable for one time  visit for its ambiance and select dishes.

Had heard about this Mexican restaurant from friends, so decided to check it out. The drinks were good, and both the quesadilla and wraps were very tasty. Nachos were above average. The ambience was also quite nice. While the flavours may not be the most authentic Mexican, it was still a good experience overall.

We have ordered the best sellers of this place which is loaded nachos and sexy maxi pizza. Both are available in jain.
Both were the best. Although nachos has that beans in it which I don't prefer much.
Somehow quesadilla was not available in jain. Although my friends have ordered regular one- oozing grilled three cheese quesadilla and found okay.
Drinks were normal.

The ambience was great but the atmosphere was little down despite of music as it was noisy due to the crowd.

Service was alright. It took reasonable time in serving all.

Visited Mexicano by the Bay recently. While the ambience was quite pleasant and the location near the riverfront makes it a great place to hang out after dinner, I found the food to be a bit bland in taste. It‚Äôs a nice spot if you‚Äôre looking for a calm dining experience with a good vibe, but the flavors could use some improvement

The food tasted pretty close to authentic Mexican flavors. The cafe‚Äôs vibe, with all the beautiful artwork, a cool graffiti wall, and little windows with flowers, totally gave me Coco vibes. Overall, it was a great dining experience‚Äîthe enchiladas were amazing, the tacos were a bit of a letdown, but the burritos were super filling!

We were a 16 member group and were met with very patient service staff and amazing ambience which everybody enjoyed. With prior intimation they had arranged for our group size and all the food was served quick. Great experience!!

Food was good‚Ä¶ We tried fully loaded nachos and mexican pizza‚Ä¶ Mexican pizza was really unique and great at the same time‚Ä¶ Must try if you are looking for a good eatery near riverfront with good ambiance

From its well-maintained sports and fitness amenities to its elegant dining options like ‡™∏‡™∞‡™≠‡™∞‡™æ, every aspect of the club exudes quality and attention to detail. The lush greenery and serene ambiance provide a refreshing escape from the city‚Äôs hustle, while the courteous and professional staff ensure every visit is smooth and enjoyable. Whether it‚Äôs for a family outing, a business meeting, or simply to unwind, Karnavati Club truly stands out as a premier spot for leisure and entertainment.
Excellent club is one of the oldest in Ahmedabad rooms here are nest and clean also the food is very good .. sports facilities are also good

As a member for the past 30 years, me and my family has always appreciated the events, activities, and overall management at the club. However, this year has been quite disappointing. The sophistication and charm that once defined the club seem to have diminished. Since Covid, there have been few major events, and those that were organized lacked proper management.

Today‚Äôs Sharad Purnima event (a paid one) was particularly disheartening. The atmosphere felt chaotic, with attendees crowding the food stalls as if it were a free food drive. It was a far cry from the well-organized and elegant events I‚Äôve come to expect from the club prior to the pandemic. I‚Äôm unsure if the new management is to blame, but this experience is certainly not what long-standing members like myself have invested in. I wish the member see and analyze, is this the service we deserved after paying lacs for the membership. And the hilarious thing is the management at the front desk confidently says now the club has become 7 star. To be honest, this experience doesn‚Äôt even lead to getting 1 star for the club.

I sincerely hope the management takes this feedback constructively and focuses on addressing these issues, rather than dismissing them. I am more than willing to pay for quality experiences, but this felt disrespectful to members who have supported the club for years.

This is one of the worst hotels I‚Äôve stayed in. The google review says it‚Äôs 4+ stars, but if I was able to give a negative I would. This hotel was so nasty, the room was covered in dust and the pillows were stained yellow. Our bathroom had a blurred window which was scratched so someone can see straight into our shower, the bathroom always smells bad. The night stands were glued, door handles were rusted. Linens and towels were dirty. Overall it was pretty bad, nasty and smelly place. I would  not recommend this to anyone.

Nice place as expected. Kathiyawadi food is good at least, we can't say it was best. Otherwise atmosphere is very nice. All the amenities are well maintained. If you are a member of club, you can get more benifits. All the festivals are also celebrated here. Most recommended plalace

Visited with family for dinner with my friends darshak kaneria and brijen trambadia...
Best place to hang out with family...
Food was very delicious...
Attended an Indian Ocean Band musical concert twice at this place. It's a good venue for multiple purposes.

The Golden Glory Hall at Karnavati Club has long been an iconic venue in Ahmedabad, much like its counterpart, Rajpath Club. For many years, it was synonymous with lavish events, particularly weddings and grand receptions, setting a benchmark for elegance and exclusivity in the city's social calendar. There was a definite time when choosing the Golden Glory Hall meant you were guaranteed a top-tier, luxurious experience, marked by impeccable service and a prestigious address.

The hall itself remains impressively spacious, easily accommodating large gatherings, which is still a significant advantage for substantial events. The overall ambiance of Karnavati Club, with its established reputation and excellent amenities, certainly adds to the appeal of the Golden Hall. Its convenient location and ample parking facilities continue to be strong positive points, making it a practical choice for many.

However, the landscape of event venues in Ahmedabad has transformed dramatically in recent years. A multitude of newer, purpose-built banquet halls and convention centers have emerged, boasting cutting-edge designs, state-of-the-art technology, and highly customizable spaces. When compared to these modern contenders, the Golden glory Hall, while still well-maintained, can sometimes feel a little dated in its decor and amenities. The sheer opulence and contemporary sophistication offered by some of the city's newer venues often outshine what was once considered peak luxury at the Golden glory Hall. They often feature more advanced audiovisual setups, innovative lighting, and fresh, trending aesthetic concepts that the Golden glory Hall, in its current form, might struggle to match.

In essence, the Golden Hall at Karnavati Club remains a reliable and functional venue, especially for those who value the club's esteemed legacy, reputation, and convenient location. It's a solid choice for traditional celebrations. However, for those seeking the very latest in modern luxury, cutting-edge facilities, and a truly contemporary, grand aesthetic, Ahmedabad now offers a wider array of options that might be more aligned with current trends and expectations. It's a good hall with a rich history, but the market has evolved with more contemporary and luxurious offerings.

placeMetadata.name: Little French House

sources.snippet: It feels as if the cafe was created to be Instagram friendly. With their cozy chairs, comfort is offered at best here. Even the plates serving food are so aesthetic that you post them immediately.
sources.shortName: Best Instagrammable Food Places In Ahmedabad

placeMetadata.description: Trendy cafe with a bakery showcasing breads, pastries & cakes, plus global meals & coffee.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Little French House is a trendy cafe and bakery in the heart of Ahmedabad, offering a delightful selection of French pastries, breads, cakes, and global meals. The cafe's ambiance is designed to transport visitors to the charming lanes of France. The menu features both traditional and contemporary French dishes made with quality ingredients and special techniques. This small French patisserie is always bustling with customers eager to indulge in exclusive French delicacies not commonly found in the area.
placeMetadata.address: Near, Sardar Patel Stadium Rd, opposite Nidhi Hospital, Swastik Society, Navrangpura, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380009, India

reviews.reviewText:
This place is amazing for food as well as ambience. They have great service.
We had ordered fries it was 5/5 and the quantity is really good. Their menu is huge and have a lots of options. I've still got to try the Chicago deep dish pizza, so I'm gonna go there again.

They also have their own bake house so we took a macaroon and butter croissant from there. Those were also really good.
A must visit place!

Good place to have a fine dine dinner.
Parking facility sucks so as the waiting time, generally 45 to 60 minutes of waiting time even on weekdays.

Good sides are the food presentation, decent cafe aesthetics, and food quality. The prices are of course on the higher side but the quality justifies the same.

We tried the most famous deep dish pizza for which we went for, along with farmer‚Äôs tear and share bread and many more other things. Worth visiting the place once.

Their food quality, quantity and pricing are all justifiably good. The food is tasty and of high quality than average. We tried their Hot Chocolate, Cafe Latte, Mocha and Avocado Cheese Croissant. The croissant and its filling was soft, fresh, cheesy and decadent. We loved every bite of it as the ingredients used were clearly fresh and tasted great.

The Ambience and interiors are modern as well which adds to the mood. Overall a 4/5 star cafe. They have a large set of variety in snacks, beverages and deserts which I find to be appealing to a wide audience of differing food palette.

Stepping into Little French House Cafe feels like being transported to a cozy corner of Paris, right here in Ahmedabad. While bakeries pop up frequently, this one has truly carved a special place in my heart. For me, a visit here isn't just about the delectable pastries; it's about the joy of selecting a perfect treat to brighten a friend's day or bring a smile to a family member's face. It's an edible expression of love, and that's something truly unique.
The ambiance is wonderfully contradictory ‚Äì a vibrant buzz fills the air, yet there's an undeniable sense of calm that allows you to relax and savor the moment. It's the kind of place where conversations flow easily amidst the happy chatter.

Yes, the prices lean towards the higher side, but honestly, the quality and the overall experience make it worth that occasional splurge. Think of it as an investment in a little slice of happiness, perfect for a monthly treat or a special occasion.

I have a reason for 1 star. Just look at the photo of hash brown served. Does it really look like hash brown ?? It looks like an veg omlet served. Best part is when we called up chef to understand yeh aisa kyun banaya, they were like chef is not allowed to come.
So folks if u are not hash brown lover then u must visit this place and try other food items which are delicious but if u want to go for Hash Brown then this is a big no

A Little French House in Ahmedabad is a dreamy escape tucked into the heart of the city. From the moment you step in, you're transported to a quaint French corner - full of charm, warmth, and artistic detail. The ambiance is a perfect blend of vintage French aesthetics and modern comfort, with every nook thoughtfully curated.

The food is a standout - fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated. Whether it's their signature desserts, hand-crafted coffees, or gourmet meals, everything is made with love and finesse. The staff is incredibly warm and attentive, making you feel like a welcome guest rather than just a customer.

Ideal for brunch dates, cozy catch-ups, or even solo time with a book, this place is more than a caf√© - it's an experience. A true hidden gem in Ahmedabad that you‚Äôll find yourself returning to again and again....

All the food items that we tried were worth waiting.

As this place will have a long waiting time so you have to wait for 30min to 1 hr for your number.

Must try Ravioli, Lasagna, Deep dish pizza. Added the pic for your reference.

Absolutely Loved It!
The food and atmosphere here are simply the best‚Äîno doubt about it! Every dish was flavorful and beautifully presented. A special shoutout to Tsusu, who served us with so much warmth and care, truly made the experience extra special.
Highly recommended, and definitely a must-visit place.

ops.insert: Manmade lake from the 1500s, with amusement rides, adrenaline attractions & parks lining its shores.
Serene mosque & tomb complex with a lake & an eclectic Indo-Saracenic design, completed in 1451.
Ancient architectural site featuring a stepwell dating to late 1400s with intricate wall carvings.
Historic mosque built in 1573, famed for latticework carved into intricate tree designs.
Textile museum devoted to 5 centuries of Indian fabrics & weaving techniques; reservations required.
Serene lake surrounded by marshland, home to the Thol Wildlife Sanctuary with pelicans & flamingos.
Site of Hindu spirituality with museum about life and work of former Indian leader, Mahatma Gandhi.
Covered outdoor showcase of high-end vintage automobiles, carriages, motorcycles & other vehicles.
Mysterious ‚Äúshaking minarets,‚Äù where the shaking of one tower results in the vibration of the other.
Small urban lake surrounded by a walking path offers an open-air theater & a children's park.
Public garden & market where street vendors hawk saris, embroidered textiles & local crafts.
This riverfront promenade along the Sabarmati River features parks, boating, a zip-line & more.
Large, 19th-century marble Jain temple with elaborate architecture featuring intricate carvings.

Affluent, riverside Ellisbridge is known for green spaces like the peaceful Riverfront Flower Park and the shady Law Garden, with mature trees and walking paths. At night, streets bordering the garden host the lively Handicraft Market, which sells embroidered fabric, appliqu√© arts, and Indian clothing. Nearby, food stalls dish up Gujarati snacks, while upscale eateries close to the river serve Indian and global fare.
Ancient underground stepwell with elaborate wall carvings that provided access to a water source.
Dedicated to India's first Deputy PM, this museum tells the story of India's early democracy.
Museum known for pre-Mughal paintings, bronzes & sculptures, plus rare manuscripts & coins.
Historic queens' tomb complex, with vendors selling costume jewelry & women‚Äôs apparel.

Historic Lal Darwaja, part of the Old City, is home to the 1573 Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, famed for its stone latticework windows with geometric and tree-shaped designs. A lively, wide promenade runs beside the Sabarmati River, with many small temples nearby. The sprawling Bhadra Fort dates from the 15th century, and street-food stalls and low-key eateries serving Mughlai-style food dot the area‚Äôs narrow lanes.
Gujarati & Indian dishes served in an open-air setting designed to resemble a traditional village.
Relaxed park area featuring shady spots, benches, a children's playground & a pond with a fountain.
Rustic-chic restaurant offering vegetarian dumplings, sandwiches & noodle plates.
Contemporary, cavernous gallery featuring artwork by Maqbool Fida Husain, plus a cafe & garden.
International dishes & coffee served in a laid-back environment filled with cool art & furniture.
Exhibits of rare, patterned kites in a modernist building designed by French architect Le Corbusier.
This modest dining room lined with Indian artwork & sculptures prepares classic Gujarati cuisine.
Compact, straightforward counter-serve preparing pizza with vegetarian options, plus pasta & salads.
Imaginative restaurant offering nachos, homemade pizza & plentiful desserts, plus drinks.
Trendy cafe with a bakery showcasing breads, pastries & cakes, plus global meals & coffee.
Interactive museum with exhibits designed to facilitate dialogue about historical conflicts via art.
Zoological park on 117 lakeside acres showcasing albino animals, endangered birds & reptiles.
Tranquil fresh water reservoir & artificial lake where birds like flamingoes and sarus cranes dwell.
Relaxed park featuring shady spots, a walking path, benches, a small lake & children's playground.
Green space popular for exercise, honoring a Hindu god of healing with medicinal plants & herbs.
Historic, tree-lined city park with lawns for activities & picnics, seating areas & a fountain.
Art, wood carvings, brass statues & idols line the walls at this long-running source for gifts.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Ahmedabad, a city that beautifully blends tradition and modernity, is a treasure trove for photography enthusiasts. From the intricate carvings of historical sites to the vibrant colors of local markets, every corner of this bustling metropolis offers a unique backdrop for capturing memories. Imagine standing before the stunning Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, where the delicate latticework creates mesmerizing patterns of light and shadow, or exploring the serene Sabarmati Riverfront, where lush gardens meet the tranquil waters, perfect for those golden hour shots.

As you wander through Ahmedabad, you'll discover a mix of iconic landmarks and hidden gems that tell the story of this vibrant city. The Adalaj Stepwell, with its stunning architecture and rich history, invites you to capture its beauty from every angle, while the lively atmosphere of the Law Garden Night Market provides a colorful canvas filled with local crafts and street food. Whether you're an amateur photographer or a seasoned pro, Ahmedabad's diverse landscapes and cultural richness will inspire you to explore and snap away. So grab your camera and get ready to uncover the best photo spots this city has to offer!
